title: " Beginner's Gardening Guide: Grow Your First Garden Like a Pro in Just 90 Seconds! "

subtasks: Determine gardening goals
Assess space for sunlight, soil, and layout
Choose climate-appropriate, easy-to-grow plants (e.g., tomatoes, basil, marigolds)
Gather tools and supplies (trowel, hand fork, pruners, gloves, watering can)
Clear garden area of weeds and debris
Loosen soil and add organic matter (compost)
Decide garden type (in-ground, raised beds, containers) based on space and needs
Choose between starting from seeds or seedlings, considering cost and convenience
For seeds, follow instructions for depth and spacing; for seedlings, harden off before transplanting
Water plants gently, providing optimal conditions (morning or late afternoon)
Use mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds
Fertilize with organic options like compost or fish emulsion
Prune regularly for growth and pest management using natural remedies (neem oil, beneficial insects)
Harvest vegetables, herbs, and flowers when mature, cutting flowers in the morning for freshness

Determine gardening goals
Assess your garden space for sunlight, soil quality, and layout
Choose plants suitable for your climate and ease of growth (e.g., tomatoes, basil, marigolds)
Gather essential gardening tools, including a trowel, hand fork, pruners, gloves, and a watering can
Clear the garden area of weeds and debris
Loosen the soil and add organic matter such as compost
Decide on garden type (in-ground beds, raised beds, or containers) based on space and needs
Choose between starting plants from seeds or seedlings, considering cost and convenience
For seeds, follow depth and spacing instructions from the packet
For seedlings, harden them off before transplanting
Water plants gently, ideally in the morning or late afternoon
Use mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds
Fertilize with organic options such as compost or fish emulsion
Prune plants regularly to encourage growth and manage pests using natural remedies like neem oil or beneficial insects
Harvest vegetables and herbs when they reach the desired size
Cut flowers in the morning for freshness
